channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Here’s the real reason 75% of corporate AI initiatives fail
item.description: 'Adding AI to a business model of the past doesn’t lead to competitiveness—it simply solidifies old processes,' writes the author of The Humanchine.

item.title: Why Restoring Power After Helene Is Complicated
item.description: Damage went beyond downed power lines. Hundreds of substations went out after the storm. Getting them back online is difficult.

item.title: What to Watch For in Tuesday’s Vance-Walz Debate
item.description: As the two running mates hold their first debate in New York, here is what to be on the lookout for.

item.title: California just took the biggest shot yet against legacy admissions
item.description: “The California Dream shouldn’t be accessible to just a lucky few,” Gov. Gavin Newsom said.

item.title: Assange, in First Speech Since Release, Says He Was Jailed for Journalism
item.description: Julian Assange, the WikiLeaks founder, said in public remarks in Strasbourg, France, that his imprisonment had set a dangerous precedent.

item.title: As Crisis Builds, Lebanon’s Government Is Nowhere to Be Found
item.description: Already crippled by years of economic decline, political paralysis and other crises, Lebanon has little but its own citizens’ grit to survive the Isra...

item.title: Homeowners are sitting on more than $35 trillion in equity
item.description: The value of all homes owned is more than double what it was a decade ago.

item.title: Meet the 2024 MacArthur ‘genius grant’ recipients
item.description: The 22 fellows will each receive a grant of $800,000 over five years to spend however they want.

item.title: Four Killed and Several Injured in Tel Aviv Shooting
item.description: The shooting took place on a major thoroughfare just as an eerie quiet descended on the city ahead of a widely anticipated Iranian missile attack.

item.title: Port Strike Begins on East and Gulf Coasts
item.description: Members of the International Longshoremen’s Association walked out for the first time since 1977 in a standoff over wages, benefits and job security.

item.title: We May Be Moments From a Ballistic Missile War in the Mideast
item.description: And this one could involve the United States.

item.title: Live Updates: Iran Launches Over 100 Ballistic Missiles at Israel
item.description: Air raid sirens sounded, loud booming explosions were heard above Tel Aviv, and flashes of light from the arcing intercepting rockets of Israel’s air-...

item.title: US job openings rose in August, surprising economists
item.description: The Labor Department reported Tuesday that employers posted 8 million vacancies in August, up from 7.7 million in July.

item.title: U.S. Raises New Concerns Over Chinese Lending Practices
item.description: A Treasury official will call for greater transparency over emergency currency “swap” loans to struggling countries by China’s central bank.

item.title: As Crisis Builds, Lebanon’s Government Is Nowhere to Be Found
item.description: Already crippled by years of economic decline, political paralysis and other crises, Lebanon has little but its own citizens’ grit to survive the Isra...
